Diamondback Firearms is proud to present the DB9, a micro-compact 9mm pistol made entirely in the USA. Designed with safety in mind, the DB9 features a "ZERO-Energy" striker firing system with a mechanical firing pin block, a steel magazine catch to secure a sheet metal magazine and real windage-adjustable sights, all in a lightweight pistol. title: For Sale/Trade:  Daisy Heddon .22 Caseless VL rifle and 1000 rounds of Ammunition
postcontent:
Daisy Heddon .22 Caseless VL pump rifle, Very good condition. 18” barrel, bore is very good. Metal is very good, Synthetic stock is very good. 

Fires .22 caseless ammunition, pack of 1000 rnds included. 
Only fifteen thousand of these were made. These are becoming more and more collectable and harder to find. 
The caseless firearm and ammunition system produced was actually made by Daisy, the airgun maker, in 1968. The Daisy V/L Rifle used a .22 caliber (5.5 mm) low-powered caseless round with no primer. The rifle is basically a spring-piston air rifle, but when used with the V/L ammunition the energy from the compression of the piston heated the air behind the caseless cartridge enough to ignite the propellant, and this generated the bulk of the energy of firing. The Daisy V/L Rifle system was discontinued in 1969 after the ATF ruled that it was not an airgun, but a firearm, which Daisy was not licensed to produce.

alternate e-mail: REDACTED

For fast tracking and smooth target acquisition, the M&P SHIELD is standard with a 5.3-inch sight radius and has been enhanced with a short, consistent trigger pull measuring 6.5 pounds. Featuring a quick and audible reset made possible by the striker-fired action, the M&P SHIELD allows multiple rounds to be placed on target both consistently and accurately.

 The Glock 21SF has some minor exterior design changes as compared to the Glock 21. This is a brand new in box Glock 22 Generation 4 pistol chambered in .40 S&W. The GLOCK 22 Gen4, in .40, introduces revolutionary design changes to this model of perfection that the majority of law enforcement across the country put their trust in every day. The Modular Back Strap design of the G22 Gen4 lets you instantly customize its grip to adapt to an individual shooter's hand size, including the popular new beavertail backstrap. The surface of the frame employs the new scientifically designed, real-world-tested, Gen4 rough textured technology. The GLOCK, non-fiberglass, reinforced polymer frame helped revolutionize the handgun industry by delivering a new standard in high-impact resistance, durability, and extended life all while significantly reducing weight. All GLOCK metal parts are treated with a Nitration finishing process that optimizes the molecular structure of those surfaces. This progressive technology delivers a high degree of surface hardness, maximum durability, and exceptional corrosion resistance, that provides many years of trouble-free service under the harshest environmental conditions.

GLOCK barrels are manufactured using a cold-hammer forging method, with surface treatment and rounded interior profiles allowing for uniform precision and consistency—even after a high number of rounds have been fired. Plus, polygonal rifling leads to a better gas seal that translates to higher velocities, increased accuracy, and a substantial reduction in maintenance.

title: For Trade:  Seekins Precision Billet Stripped AR Lower-Must See!
postcontent:
Best-looking lower I've ever seen, and extremely nice. In great condition. 

The SP 223 Billet lower features a unique design geared towards the serious tactical shooter. The oversized winter trigger guard, quick access mag release, beveled mag well, ambi bolt drop and user friendly features make this lower the best on the market. To ease assembly Seekins Precision eliminated the use of roll pins, hammers, punches and replaced them with custom screw in dowel pins. We installed an upper tensioning set screw, a set screw for trigger reset, relocated and retained the rear take down pin detent under the grip. Our ambidextrous bolt control allows the shooter to quickly drop the bolt or from either side of the firearm. The unique magwell design allows positive mag changes and allows the use of most all mags including Magpul P-mag and Surefire high capacity mags.

Designed for professionals, the GLOCK 17, in 9x19, is one of the most widely used law enforcement pistol worldwide. Because of its unsurpassed reliability, above-average magazine capacity of 17 rounds in the standard magazine, and its low weight, it is trusted by law enforcement officers around the globe. With Glock's revolutionary "Safe Action" trigger system, the G17 9x19 pistol is safe, easy, and quick-just what you need in high-pressure situations. Trigger pull weight is a comfortable 5.5 pounds and trigger travel is a crisp .5".

The GLOCK, non-fiberglass, reinforced polymer frame helped revolutionize the handgun industry by delivering a new standard in high-impact resistance, durability, and extended life all while significantly reducing weight. All GLOCK metal parts are treated with a Nitration finishing process that optimizes the molecular structure of those surfaces. This progressive technology delivers a high degree of surface hardness, maximum durability, and exceptional corrosion resistance, that provides many years of trouble-free service under the harshest environmental conditions.

GLOCK barrels are manufactured using a cold-hammer forging method, with surface treatment and rounded interior profiles allowing for uniform precision and consistency—even after a high number of rounds have been fired. Plus, polygonal rifling leads to a better gas seal that translates to higher velocities, increased accuracy, and a substantial reduction in maintenance.

This pistol includes a speed loader and ships in a Glock branded padded hard case.

Caliber: 9x19mm
Capacity: Two 17 round magazines included
Barrel: 4.5" Cold Hammer Forged, 1:10" twist, polygonal rifled
Dimensions: 8" long, 5.4" high, 1.26" wide
Weight: 22.2 ounces unloaded, 32.1 ounces loaded

title: For Sale:  30-30 Marlin® Model 336 Lever-Action Rifle
postcontent:
30-30 Marlin® Model 336 Lever-Action Rifle with Bushnell Sportview Scope

This was my childhood 30-30 Marlin® Model 336 Lever-Action Rifle and is approximately 29-years old.  I recently had the Bushnell Sportview Scope (4X-38, Mod. #: 74-4389-0) professionally-sighted at Bald Mountain Shooting Range & Gun Shop in Lake Orion, Michigan.  The rifle still shoots "dead-on" at a 100 yards and was determined to be in 90% or better condition by the firearms department at Gander Mountain in Shelby Township.  

For you aficionados, the rifle has the "JM stamp" on the left side of the barrel near the receiver, which is the PROOF MARK that indicates the rifle has been sucessfully fired in the "proofing box" using a SAAMI proof load. The rifle must be capable of maintaining proper head space under the ignition pressure of the proof load. The head space is measured before and after the test.

In addition, I will throw in 6-1/2 cases x 20 cartridges of BRAND NEW Hornady 30-30 30-30 Win 140 gr MonoFlex™ LEVERevolution® Ammunition (#82731) valued at $30/box of 20 or $195.00.  10 cartridges were used for sighting in the scope.  This ammunition is temporarily suspended due to limited production availability by Hornady.

For sale are two nice pieces of tactical kit for an AR-15 user. This is a Troy Industries "Modular Rail, Forend M4 Carbine" , its a drop in kit so you don't have to remove your barrel nut/delta ring assembly, just take off your normal plastic 2-piece handguard and install this. title: For Sale:  Beretta PX4 Storm Sub-Compact 9mm
postcontent:
I collect firearms and have done so for over 30 years.  This is one of the absolute best models you can buy, regardless of price, for a concealable personal protection piece.  The quality is second to none with the fit and finish world class.  I own two of the 9mm PX4's and 2 of the .40 PX4 pistols.  To be perfectly honest, I do not know if this pistol has ever been fired.  I wiped it down with a white cloth and it came out clean, but that doesn't prove I never fired it because that is how I keep all of my firearms.  Needless to say, the pistol and all accessories are in 100% condition.  Beretta is actually the longest operating company in the world.  They have been in business for 500 years; yes, FIVE HUNDRED years!  Here is a small example of how reliable the PX4 is:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9ZzJ-gT2jR0  

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V5Cc6A_Tnbo

The PX4 Storm 9mm sub-compact comes with two 13 round factory mags, one has a little lip that flips down to give you a larger grip area.  A really cool design for a magazine.  This pistol comes with everything that was sent with it from the factory; both 13 round mags, manuals, warranty card, mag loader box and, of course, the pistol.  I've been a Glock fan for decades and the PX4 is finally a pistol that I think may cause Glock to have some competition when it comes to semi-automatic pistols that go 'bang' every single time you pull the trigger whether you take great care of your firearm or not.  The PX4 will have a milder recoil than about any 9mm sub-compact pistol on the market.  Combine that with 13 rounds, proven durability and superior fit and finish and you have a winner!  Check the prices for a PX4 Storm 9mm sub-compact.  You will then see that this is a real deal at $450!  Thanks for looking!

Buyer must have valid IN identification and preferably a LTCH as well.

Glock 21 SF Generation 3 pistol chambered in .45 ACP. This Glock features a unique and practical limited edition Olive Drab Green frame. Remarkable for its accuracy and light recoil, the GLOCK 21 delivers the legendary stopping power of the .45 Auto round with a 13 round magazine capacity. Countless law enforcement units swear by the G21 pistol, and that's why this powerful, lightweight, all climate workhorse is standard issue from the North to South Poles. The SF model reduces the circumference of the receiver at the rear, or "back strap," offering increased comfort and control—especially for shooters with smaller hands.

The GLOCK, non-fiberglass, reinforced polymer frame helped revolutionize the handgun industry by delivering a new standard in high-impact resistance, durability, and extended life all while significantly reducing weight. All GLOCK metal parts are treated with a Nitration finishing process that optimizes the molecular structure of those surfaces. This progressive technology delivers a high degree of surface hardness, maximum durability, and exceptional corrosion resistance, that provides many years of trouble-free service under the harshest environmental conditions.

GLOCK barrels are manufactured using a cold-hammer forging method, with surface treatment and rounded interior profiles allowing for uniform precision and consistency—even after a high number of rounds have been fired. Plus, polygonal rifling leads to a better gas seal that translates to higher velocities, increased accuracy, and a substantial reduction in maintenance.

This pistol includes a speed loader and ships in a Glock branded padded hard case.

Bolt: Bolt is made of Mil-spec Carpenter 158 steel, Shot peened, and MPI. Gas key is secured with grade 8 fasteners and staked per mil-spec. Bolt carrier is parkerized outside, chrome lined inside.
Lower:  These forged lowers are quality made using 7075-T6 aluminum and are marked “MULTI” for caliber.  Finish is Black Hardcoat Anodize per MIL-8625 Type 3 class 2.  Mil-spec sized buffer tube is forged of 7075 aluminum, is dry film lube coated on the inside, has 6 adjustment positions, is finished with an M4 stock and has a staked castle nut.  Standard carbine buffer is Black anodized and has the PSA logo on the face.  The standard PSA combat trigger has a smooth pull and clean break.

title: For Sale:  Model 1809 Potsdam Marine contract percussion conversion musket
postcontent:
Excellent condition model 1809 Potsdam Marine contract musket converted to percussion in the 1840s.  Marine contract 1809s differ significantly from the much more common Army contract muskets to make them seaworthy.  Marine contract musket has same length .75 cal smooth bore barrel, very similar stock, same butt plate, lock plate, trigger, and trigger guard, and same nose cap band.  

Please e-mail if interested in more photos.  Note in the last photo provided here, it is the upper musket.  The one on the table is the standard army model included in the photo just for comparison purposes.
It differs in the following features.  
1.  Barrel is blackened for protection against rusting.  
2.  Steel ramrod replaced by wood ramrod again because wood doesn't rust.  
3.  Bayonet attachment omitted (19th c military philosophy viewed bayonets as a weapon against cavalry, deemed unnecessary for naval combat and an unneeded expense).  
4.  2nd and 3rd barrel bands as well as the inset retaining springs omitted.  These were not removed at a later date, the musket was built without them, so it never had the retaining spring grooves cut, nor the step down notches for the bands to rest against, resulting in a nice smooth stock.   Due to the lack of the 2nd barrel band, it also has no forward sling attachment, another feature deemed unnecessary for naval combat.  
5.  Concave cheek rest omitted.  
6.  Stock is shellacked for added protection against the wetness of the naval environment.  

This really is a beautiful gun and may have been a Civil War import as there are no modern import markings on it.  Thousands of Potsdam muskets were imported by the Union during the war, mainly to keep them from being bought by the Confederacy.   But some did find their way out to western units, some being used by city militias, and some just being put into storage for emergencies.  

Lock and trigger function properly, and the nipple is NOT smashed.  This one has been taken care of down the past two centuries.  The stock is a beautiful shade of brown with standard wear marks.  There is a crack behind the barrel on the right side, but it was repaired in antiquity.

That being said, I am not a lawyer and am not responsible for your not doing your due diligence regarding the use of this item in your state.  I can email pictures.

This item is manufactured by Satern Machining (.com) and retails on their site for 65+shipping. I am asking 50 shipped or best offer.

title: For Sale:  Kel-Tec SUB-2000 Tan FDE 9mm Carbine Compact Rifle Glock Mag
postcontent:
If you are reading this, then, yes, I still have it. Emails asking, "do you still have it" will be ignored. If you wish to purchase, please call: REDACTED.

This listing is for a NEW Tan Kel-Tec Sub 2000 G17 folding carbine, chambered in 9mm with a 16.1" barrel. It accepts all Glock Model 17 magazines, and comes with one mag. This gun is ideal when you need the firepower of a long gun but need something light weight and very compact. It can be carried/concealed in just about anything and deployed instantly. Using readily available Glock 17 mags, this carbine makes for an ideal self-defense gun that can be taken just about anywhere with ease.

The SUB-2000 has a greatly extended range compared to a handgun. The superior precision is also very useful against small or partially covered targets at shorter range. The amount of training to master the SUB-2000 is only a fraction of that required for a handgun. This is an excellent choice for a vehicle gun, backpack gun, or anytime you might need something more than a handgun but do not have a lot of room and need something light and compact.

The bolt can be locked in the rear position by the operating handle. The main safety is of protected push bolt type disconnecting the trigger bar and interlocking the hammer and sear. By rotating the barrel upwards and back, the SUB 2000 can be reduced to a size of 16" x 7" to facilitate secure storage and utilize the internal deployment lock which is operated by a proprietary key. The rear sight is of aperture type and the fluorescent front sight can be adjusted for windage and elevation. The SUB-2000 can easily be disassembled without tools for cleaning or inspection.

Specs:

Manufacturer: Kel-Tec Model #: Sub-2000 Rifle (GLK-G17) Type: Rifle Finish: Tan Metal Stock: Tan Synthetic, Cerakote Finish Sights: Open Sights Barrel Length: 16.1" Overall Length: 16.1" Closed, 30" Open Weight: 4 lbs Caliber: 9mm Action: Semi-Automatic # of Mags: Features: Uses Glock G17 Mags, Folds in Half for Transportation Caution: Do Not Use Aluminum Cased Ammo

Note: The price in the listing is the cash discount price. If you wish to pay via credit card, please add 3% to the total. Arizona residents pay 7.35% state sales tax. If shipping, be sure this is legal to own where you live.
